TopicTitle: the ion engine is way too OP

Articles.Content:
jeez again with this topic use the search function you'll see this has been brought up 1000 times already its the devs decision to make the game a game and not a simulator simple as that if you like a simulator I'm sure mods will be coming out to fill your niche

personally i prefer the ion engines as they are

Does it really matter? Its not like you are going to be basing a fullon space agency off of KSP. it does incorporate SOME real life sciences (to the point it could nearly be classed as educational), but just take a look at the drag model in the first place.

KSP drag modelling is way from real life, and even FAR isn't a replica. The truth is, there is barely anything from real life that can be made a simulator. If it is made into a simulator, than people have spent TONS of hours not only researching the principles behind their simulator so that the simulation is accurate, but than they have to code it. Personally, I don't care about the ion engines thrust. In fact, I wish it was HIGHER so I didn't have to spend ages waiting for burns to other places, or so I could even whack it onto larger ships as auxiliary thrusters

I really don't get the fun in having to wait for a month real time for a burn. Each to their own though....

I'm glad about the ion buff as my time in KSP is quite limited atm.
